frameDefinitions: An Agent acts so as to be the strongest force, or most important causal factor in some Situation, to the exclusion of other competing actors.
An State_of_affairs will come to hold with respect to a Protagonist at some future time.
An Agent performs an Action incorrectly.

A State_of_affairs (a state or event) either holds or occurs, and is presented as being causally independent of other (implicit) states or events that might otherwise have been expected to be causally related to the State_of_affairs.
A Winner has victory over an Loser.
The words in this frame involve an Undesirable_event which affects the Patient negatively.
frameExamples: York <t>dominated</t> the game as they held the ball on offense almost the entire 70 minutes.
Exile was his <t>fate</t> and he triumphantly turned it into the fruit of his life.
That they got the same answers is just a <t>coincidence</t>.
The first <t>calamity</t> was a disastrous trade war with Holland.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is the most forceful and pivotal factor in the situation.
The <fen>Situation</fen> is primarily affected by the <fen>Agent</fen>, in particular how it develops or concludes.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> is dominant.
The location where the domination takes place.
The <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> that is destined to occur to the Protagonist.
The Protagonist is the one for whom the future <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is destined.
The <fen>Role</fen> filled by the <fen>Protagonist</fen> in his/her destiny.
The time for which the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s future is determined.
The location in which <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is destined to occur to the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs an action incorrectly.
<fen>Patient</fen> is the entity affected by the <fen>Agent</fen>'s bungling of an <fen>Action</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Action</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs incorrectly.
The type of action that the <fen>Agent</fen> habitually bungles.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the bungling occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the bungling occurs.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> (that is, an event or state) that holds independently of (potentially) causally-related States of affairs.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> holds.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> holds.
The individual or individuals who beat the <fen>Loser</fen>.
The individual or individuals that get beat by the <fen>Winner</fen>.
When the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory over the <fen>Loser</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory <fen>Loser</fen>.
The undesirable event which occurs.
The entity that experiences the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen>.
When the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen> occurs.
Where the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: As discussed above, Ford dominated the market <fex>in the 1920s</fex>, then left the business to create production capacity for the Model A.
Indeed, <fex>in all Latin America</fex>, United States corporations dominated the key sectors of the economy.
Deciding that his true destiny is <fex>as a healer</fex>, Henderson returns home, planning to enter medical school.
Their destiny <fex>over those years</fex> was to gradually take charge of most of the world's operations.
The Austro-Hungarian Empire had a long history of <fex>military</fex> screw-ups.
Is it a coincidence <fex>that most of the planets fall within the Titius-Bode law's boundaries</fex>?
<fex>Last night's</fex> coincidences were too much for me to handle.
Several strange coincidences <fex>at the airport</fex> got the attention of federal officials.
An <fex>environmental</fex> disaster is just what we need.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the New England Journal of Medicine
the New England Journal of Medicine
